top_comments_top.body:
Hello and welcome to r/LifeProTips!

Please help us decide if this post is a good fit for the subreddit by up or downvoting this comment. 

If you think that this is great advice to improve your life, please upvote. If you think this doesn't help you in any way, please downvote. If you don't care, leave it for the others to decide.
I get your point. For me, Amazon prime is kind of an exception. I pay for Prime Video, and I get the free shipping, as a bonus.
I get gamepass literally for free with microsoft rewards so idk what you mean by that.

There is no such thing as a free shipping, because it costs money to ship things. If you ever buy an item and it ships for “free,” it’s simply priced into the cost of the item. But no one complains that this marketing term is inaccurate. 

Prime also uses “free shipping” in its marketing. But somehow the term is fine in the first context but not in the second?

Likewise, “buy one get one free” means that items are being priced to move stock and both items are essentially reduced price. Everyone knows that’s what it means. 

Yes, I’m aware that I pay a subscription. I bought it. But one of the perks of that benefit is I can buy 10,000 $1 doohickeys a year and never have to pay an extra shipping charge on any of them.  So yes, it’s entirely accurate to say you’re paying a one-time fee to get free shipping for a year, and if you buy enough merchandise such that the individual shipping fees would outstrip the cost of membership, it makes financial sense to do so.

I know that shipping isn't free. And I know that Prime product prices include shipping costs. But for the things I buy, I already know the brick and mortar shop price. 

Very often I save money buying through Amazon and I don't have to go/drive to the shop to get it. And it usually comes in by the next day. 

Since I order from there at least once a week, the 4900yen (US$43) membership fee is a bargain. Prime video, music and photos is a bonus. Not a great one, but much better than nothing.
